body:
EDIT:

So it seems that training does start and at least 1 step is computed (if we set Display Iterations to 1), but there is a crash right after (see below).

Is it possible that tensorflow is not releasing memory properly in between terations?  We've found that explicit deletion of GPU matrices is sometimes required in both tensorflow and pytorch applications. 

Please let me know if you require additional information or tests.

Thanks!

```

,...
Starting multi-animal training....
iteration: 1 loss: 1.6002 scmap loss: 1.4529 locref loss: 0.0241 limb loss: 0.1232 lr: 0.0001
2020-06-12 15:08:41.440117: W tensorflow/core/common_runtime/bfc_allocator.cc:267] Allocator (GPU_0_bfc) ran out of memory trying to allocate 320.00MiB.  Current allocation summary follows.
```

as I mentioned #740 (https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/740#issuecomment-643017511) the GPU is too small, you would need a bigger GPU to run such frames with batchsize of 8; you can drop it to 4, as it seems as if it works for 5, that would be sufficient... 

You can monitor to see if the python session did not stop properly by watching nvidia-smi; you can simply "kill" the process if the memory is still helped up.

Ok, I see, I didn't understand what you recommended as there is no "set batch size in the GUI".  I've now set the batch size to 1 in the config.yaml file but I'm still getting memory errors after the first or second iteration.

As you can see, there are 11GB+ of GPU ram available at start up and in this particular run there were 2 iterations completed.

```.  Current allocation summary follows.

The batchsize for training is not in the config.yaml, it's in the `pose_cfg.yaml`. Please see BOX 2 in the docs

^ and anything that is larger than our defaults for cropping (which make them 400 x 400), we are using 24 GB GPUs for for training; the titan xp is not sufficient for 2000 x 1000 batch training of 8.

Ok ok, I see, yes, changing the pose_cfg.yaml batch to 4 seems to run now.

I apologize for all this confusion, but I don't understand how to read the documentation.  Where exactly is BOX 2 in the docs?  

And are there specific documents that I should look at for DLC 2.2.+ ?  I did look at 2 videos, but they didn't go deep enough.

Thanks!

BOX 2 is from the Nature Protocols paper: https://rdcu.be/bHpHN , and is in the docs/here is the defaults: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/deeplabcut/pose_cfg.yaml. 

Here is a video on how to go over the docs: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A9qZidI7tL8

Start here: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/tree/master/docs 
![Screen Shot 2020-06-12 at 4 05 56 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28102185/84542056-a5992280-acc6-11ea-91b5-808585d5f6ea.png)

Here is an overview, and a note saying that you can searchh for "**maDeepLabCut**" to see all the changes" 

![Screen Shot 2020-06-12 at 4 10 57 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28102185/84542404-615a5200-acc7-11ea-8ba4-050402a4fe90.png)

For example, here is how to use 2.2 in various scenarios:
https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/UseOverviewGuide.md#important-information-on-using-deeplabcut

and the detailed guide on every function: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/functionDetails.md

Thanks, I have now watched a few more videos and read a bit more of the docs. 
I will start a new issue to ask for more advice.

we really ask you ONLY open code bugs/issues on GitHub, and please post questions on the user Forum: https://forum.image.sc/tags/deeplabcut

Please see here:https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut#community-support-developers--help
